data.title: David Fisher Obituary - NORTH ADAMS, Massachusetts
data.meta_description: David J. Fisher, 84, of 7529 Route 7, Pownal, VT, died Sunday, July 15, 2012 at his home, surrounded by his family. He was born in Schenectady, NY on August 3, 1927, the son of the late David and Hazel (Grabo) Fisher. Mr. Fisher was a 1944 graduate of Draper High School and earned a Bachelor of Science Degree in Chemistry from Union College in 1949. He was PFC in the US Army and served in WWII from 1945 to 1947. He was a decorated Veteran, earning a Victory Medal.  In 1948, Mr. Fisher began his employment at General Electric as a Lab Assistant. In 1960, he transferred to West Milton, NY working at the submarine nuclear reactor test site. He transferred back to Pittsfield in 1969, and retired in 1986, with 6 patents and 3 Management Awards to his credit.  Mr. Fisher was an avid bowler and enjoyed computer science. He was married to Theresa Oâ€™Leary from 1948 until her death on June 15, 1980. He then married Barbara McConnell Lussier and have celebrated 32 years of marriage together.  In addition to his wife, Barbara, Mr. Fisher is survived by three sons, Frederick Fisher of Rhinebeck, NY, David Fisher, Jr. of Washington, MA, Dennis Fisher of Brooklyn, NY and three daughters, Janet Ottendorf of Duanesburg, NY, Susan Luczynski of North Adams, MA and Nancy Underwood of Clarksburg, MA. He also leaves three step-children, Wendy Accetta of Charlotte, NC, Jeff Lussier of Hudson, MA and Julie Lussier of Hunterville, NC as well as thirteen grandchildren Joseph, Matthew, MacKenzie, Cullen, Rachel, Erin, Dylan, Ryan, Zachary, Emily, Sarah, Jordon and Stratton, and one great-grandchild Stella Rose. He is predeceased by a daughter, Ann Marie Fisher and his brother, Edgar Fisher.   FUNERAL NOTICE: A graveside service with military honors for David J. Fisher will be held in Southview Cemetery, North Adams, MA, on Thursday, July 19, 2012 at 1:00 P.M. There are no calling hours. Memorial donations may be made to , in care of FLYNN &DAGNOLI-MONTAGNA HOME FOR FUNERALS, CENTRAL CHAPEL 74 Marshall St. North Adams, MA 01247, who has been entrusted with arrangements. To send a sympathy gift, card, flowers or message, please visit www.flynndagnolifuneralhomes.com.
